title: 108_s186
content: The Act titled "Living Organ Donor Protections Act" is cited in Section 1. Section 2 includes amendments to the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to protect living organ donors from discrimination based on health status, including conditions resulting from organ donation. No discrimination in group premiums based on organ donor status is allowed. The Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 is amended to prohibit discrimination in group premiums based on living organ donor status. The term 'living organ donor' is defined as an individual who donates all or part of an organ. The term 'living organ donor' is defined as an individual who donates all or part of an organ, as per the Public Health Service Act. The Public Health Service Act is amended. Living organ donation is protected by limits on preexisting conditions, including conditions resulting from the donation of an organ by a living donor. Discrimination based on health status, including living organ donor status, is prohibited in enrollment and group premiums under the Public Health Service Act. The Public Health Service Act prohibits discrimination in group health plan premiums based on living organ donor status. The Act defines a living organ donor as an individual who donates all or part of an organ. SEC. 4. AMENDMENTS TO THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include protections for living organ donation and prohibition of discrimination based on health status, specifically regarding organ donation status in group health plans. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 prohibits adjusting premium or contribution amounts based on living organ donor status in group health plans. The definition of a living organ donor is also clarified in the code. The Secretary of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Treasury will create regulations for the amendments in this Act. The amendments will apply to group health plans and insurance coverage starting on January 1, 2004.
